Title: mtr: Stack-based buffer overflow
Synopsis:
A stack-based buffer overflow was found in mtr, possibly resulting in the
    execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: mtr combines the functionality of the 'traceroute' and 'ping' programs in a single network diagnostic tool.

Description.Text: Adam Zabrocki reported a boundary error within the split_redraw() function in the file split.c, possibly leading to a stack-based buffer overflow.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could use a specially crafted resolved hostname to execute arbitrary code with root privileges. However, it is required that the attacker controls the DNS server used by the victim, and that the "-p" (or "--split") command line option is used.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All mtr users should upgrade to the latest version:
